document.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

472D6FCFD63549FBA95CDE1F4DD8A99C.description:
Describe the differences and similarities between solving linear inequalities in one variable
and linear equations in one variable.

092BD368D9D94FE8B7E40A95C3946D61.description:
Identify a numerical value(s) that is part of the solution set of as given one- or two-step linear
inequality in one variable.

40393944E45841CD955D20BC16BCCA69.description: Solve problems in context that require the solution of a one- or two-step inequality.

0CB8A16D11934778A5547E03D002E72F.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a one or two-step linear inequality in one variable.Â

A0C5A1515592419FA34DBE8D8C175680.description:
Write one- or two-step linear inequalities in one variable to represent a verbal situation,
including those in context.

35D87809493E41F8B3279CC21EE03A1A.description:
Represent solutions to one- or two-step linear inequalities in one variable algebraically and
graphically using a number line.

32C3A4DD8002499198C8AED61DACCFE4.description:
Investigate and explain how the solution set of a linear inequality is affected by multiplying or
dividing both sides of the inequality statement by a rational number less than zero.

6ACEA875D5E840728DC031E8FE53704C.description:
Apply properties of real numbers and the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
properties of inequality to solve one- and two-step inequalities in one variable. Coefficients
and numeric terms will be rational.

A85C500521214C16A1D4E453AAE9E197.description:
The student will write and solve one- and two-step linear inequalities in one variable,
including problems in context, that require the solution of a one- and two-step linear
inequality in one variable.

3D12E18246834C72B8995AD06533FFD0.description: Solve problems in context that require the solution of a two-step linear equation.

E75ED058287F4525A695B19FF3A27353.description: Create a verbal situation in context given a two-step linear equation in one variable.

CA9E39A1E6144E81A7A0D5EB7AE1986F.description:
Write a two-step linear equation in one variable to represent a verbal situation, including those
in context.

5B817AD738D24389BA54D6ABF2DDBE66.description: Confirm algebraic solutions to linear equations in one variable.

53744D14D7AF4170949DA6DBF75B90B9.description:
Apply properties of real numbers and properties of equality to solve two-step linear equations
in one variable. Coefficients and numeric terms will be rational.

0B2A5372E44641929D0714CE5AAEA7BE.description:
Represent and solve two-step linear equations in one variable using a variety of concrete
materials and pictorial representations.

A7C19113DAA94A9DB6C04D8F2F404F73.description:
The student will write and solve two-step linear equations in one variable, including
problems in context, that require the solution of a two-step linear equation in one
variable.

9313B83624E54BBAA718322B74C40160.description:
Use the order of operations and apply the properties of real numbers to evaluate algebraic
expressions for given replacement values of the variables. Exponents are limited to 1, 2, 3, or
4 and bases are limited to positive integers. Expressions should not include braces { } but may
include brackets [ ] and absolute value bars | |. Square roots are limited to perfect squares.
Limit the number of replacements to no more than three per expression. Replacement values
may be positive or negative rational numbers.

7DBA6E81B8C741BF804E76891B409523.description:
Simplify and generate equivalent algebraic expressions in one variable by applying the order
of operations and properties of real numbers. Expressions may require combining like terms
to simplify. Expressions will include only linear and numeric terms. Coefficients and numeric
terms may be positive or negative rational numbers.*

3B9F16A0D61C45DA8BE88F2E5DC1893C.description:
Represent equivalent algebraic expressions in one variable using concrete manipulatives and
pictorial representations (e.g., colored chips, algebra tiles).Â

34B87DC6A50E4CD5BA283B8DB979606C.description:
Use the order of operations and apply the properties of real numbers to simplify numerical
expressions. Exponents are limited to 1, 2, 3, or 4 and bases are limited to positive integers.
Expressions should not include braces { } but may include brackets [ ] and absolute value bars
| |. Square roots are limited to perfect squares.*

E3C32E560E1745A3960B8D2BCA3AEB54.description:
The student will simplify numerical expressions, simplify and generate equivalent
algebraic expressions in one variable, and evaluate algebraic expressions for given
replacement values of the variables.Â

CE41F17E5249448CB121F4CE362D460B.description:
Make connections between and among representations of a proportional relationship between
two quantities using problems in context, tables, equations, and graphs. Slope may include
positive or negative values (slope will be limited to positive values in a contextual situation).

F733D41F37FD476D870AE7B84A27E360.description:
Graph a line representing a proportional relationship between two quantities given the
equation of the line in the form y = mx, where m represents the slope as rate of change. Slope
may include positive or negative values.Â

A41A15C8C23B4A5C9A1F4D103FCB79EE.description:
Graph a line representing a proportional relationship, between two quantities given an ordered
pair on the line and the slope, m, as rate of change. Slope may include positive or negative
values.Â

C85242C14C324B198DB1A0D8B15B6CCC.description: Identify and describe a line with a slope that is positive, negative, or zero (0), given a graph.Â

D314062E44744D1081F5FD2DD68789CF.description:
Determine the slope, m, as the rate of change in a proportional relationship between two
quantities given a table of values, graph, or contextual situation and write an equation in the
form y = mx to represent the direct variation relationship. Slope may include positive or
negative values (slope will be limited to positive values in a contextual situation).

A5599BA9A571484489A2F2393E87C4E3.description:
The student will investigate and analyze proportional relationships between two
quantities using verbal descriptions, tables, equations in y = mx form, and graphs,
including problems in context.

E99F07C46ABC42BD9DE1C19ECE46D18C.description:
Analyze data represented in histograms by making observations and drawing conclusions.
Determine how histograms reveal patterns in data that cannot be easily seen by looking at the
corresponding given data set.

B535CDF9118F4279AAB5D4B92E252947.description:
Compare data represented in histograms with the same data represented in other graphs,
including but not limited to line plots (dot plots), circle graphs, and stem-and-leaf plots, and
justify which graphical representation best represents the data.Â

4AEDA8003D3C4651A5D1CDD7F3BA13D0.description:
Investigate and explain how using different intervals could impact the representation of the
data in a histogram.

87DE2535760748ED8D6B37A9F612E476.description:
Organize and represent numerical data using histograms with and without the use of
technology

19E51679D8CF484EAC507B1B846B47BD.description:
Determine how sample size and randomness will ensure that the data collected is a sample
that is representative of a larger population.

F2928E25AB624290BE1F3722992FB332.description:
Determine the data needed to answer a formulated question and collect the data (or acquire
existing data) using various methods (e.g., observations, measurement, surveys, experiments).

7A90B535139F41F992F965830B06D14E.description:
Formulate questions that require the collection or acquisition of data with a focus on
histograms.

F678F03B0C09461EA9B673AA33A4485E.description:
Investigate and describe the difference between the probability of an event found through
experiment or simulation versus the theoretical probability of that same event.

C5383D86322B4A3F93D2A8B5C9F9A8A4.description: Describe changes in the experimental probability as the number of trials increases.

6DEC8FC0962D4C66941322F22AD5BE64.description:
Given the results of a statistical investigation, determine the experimental probability of an
event.

797D4D981C924F48B36069A689FE12D6.description: Determine the theoretical probability of an event.

2D5A52E30B134D118E1C75B5755885C1.description:
The student will use statistical investigation to determine the probability of an event and
investigate and describe the difference between the experimental and theoretical
probability.

DD1750B883524CE39C0B30E444F4B319.description:
Identify and describe dilations in context including, but not limited to, scale drawings and
graphic design.

609DA45421A84F91B1BF5A430B4384E3.description:
Sketch the image of a dilation of a polygon limited to a scale factor of 1
4
,
1
2
, 2, 3, or 4. The
center of the dilation will be the origin.

2D2F9BC71E3148AFAFC969D47A8F3148.description:
Given a preimage in the coordinate plane, identify the coordinates of the image of a polygon
that has been dilated. Scale factors are limited to 1
4
,
1
2
, 2, 3, or 4. The center of the dilation will
be the origin.

589FB1FE90874780A7F3EEC7FD7FED30.description: The student will apply dilations of polygons in the coordinate plane.

92B11B91D821415CAC1A755CE159B806.description:
Given a diagram, determine an unknown side length in a quadrilateral using properties of
quadrilaterals.

91FE84EA5DD0479882622B42EA76E8AA.description:
Given a diagram, determine an unknown angle measure in a quadrilateral, using properties of
quadrilaterals.

CF70B97FEDD34036976BB605FAC449CA.description: Sort and classify quadrilaterals as parallelograms, rectangles, trapezoids, rhombi, and/or squares based on their properties: lines of symmetry

3C76C9CBAFD34D88BB11B4F75CEEA19C.description: Sort and classify quadrilaterals as parallelograms, rectangles, trapezoids, rhombi, and/or squares based on their properties: congruence of angle measures, side, and diagonal lengths

7EE95F94E769415489D55B35F8117505.description: Sort and classify quadrilaterals as parallelograms, rectangles, trapezoids, rhombi, and/or squares based on their properties:Â  parallel/perpendicular sides and diagonals

4BA7BC36246D4E88AFA2DB2E9C95B6DD.description:
Sort and classify quadrilaterals as parallelograms, rectangles, trapezoids, rhombi, and/or
squares based on their properties:Â

59E019602E4941B49728C7DD153EFEA8.description: Compare and contrast properties of quadrilaterals to determine lines of symmetry

1C5FC46716AC49C2A4FA04F8263D7823.description: Compare and contrast properties of quadrilaterals to determine congruence of angle measures, side, and diagonal lengths

B200161CE59A41FC854B2980111BFBD9.description: Compare and contrast properties of quadrilaterals to determine parallel/perpendicular sides and diagonals

942FFC25D58048C0BB883B58E0F15F46.description:
Compare and contrast properties of the following quadrilaterals: parallelogram, rectangle,
square, rhombus, and trapezoid:

6EF076E1CB6D4684991E090F03EC19DF.description:
The student will compare and contrast quadrilaterals based on their properties and
determine unknown side lengths and angle measures of quadrilaterals.

C145FF1B5E9B4B9CB364C8566E00003E.description:
Apply proportional reasoning to solve problems in context including scale drawings. Scale
factors shall have denominators no greater than 12 and decimals no less than tenths.

AEE0EDDF137547CBA6088892E044AAAA.description:
Given angle measures in a quadrilateral or triangle, determine unknown angle measures in a
similar quadrilateral or triangle.

535FBEBD955E469BBBA0E1F0DA1D9050.description: Solve a proportion to determine a missing side length of similar quadrilaterals or triangles.

6669C4ED59F74AC6A39A36A55BF9F165.description:
Recognize and justify if two quadrilaterals or triangles are similar using the ratios of
corresponding side lengths.Â

F877221E28124E7D8665CACA137E21C1.description:
Write proportions to express the relationships between the lengths of corresponding sides of
similar quadrilaterals and triangles.Â

18703B74C1664C2490DE1742EC62CBE2.description: Given two similar quadrilaterals or triangles, write similarity statements using symbols.

D41002B9FF4D4A13AC5DF7AAE5D71196.description: Identify corresponding sides of similar quadrilaterals and triangles.

10C2493158BC455AA0462DCF0996490C.description:
Identify corresponding congruent angles of similar quadrilaterals and triangles, through the
use of geometric markings.

8A4075D476944558BD1A922781CE60DE.description:
The student will solve problems and justify relationships of similarity using
proportional reasoning.

687F68A47EB44B72915C048ABD8528AE.description:
Describe how the surface area of a rectangular prism is affected when one measured attribute
is multiplied by a factor of 1
2
or 2, including those in contextual situations.

834FBC06538C4FBABBE86F25DBB4698D.description:
Describe how the volume of a rectangular prism is affected when one measured attribute is
multiplied by a factor of 1
4
,
1
3
,
1
2
, 2, 3, or 4, including those in contextual situations.

6AB8B50690194884930D61865685B261.description:
Determine if a problem in context, involving a rectangular prism or right cylinder, represents
the application of volume or surface area.

A58F9334450C45C3B667B1A0B5C5E4DA.description:
Develop the formulas for determining the surface area of rectangular prisms and right
cylinders and solve problems, including those in contextual situations, using concrete objects,
two-dimensional diagrams, nets, and formulas.

C57FAE390A7047CF967F4365CF25D042.description:
Develop the formulas for determining the volume of right cylinders and solve problems,
including those in contextual situations, using concrete objects, diagrams, and formulas.Â

C92200CC5F554ABE80A41AB7D3701D33.description:
The student will investigate and determine the volume formula for right cylinders and
the surface area formulas for rectangular prisms and right cylinders and apply the
formulas in context.

D302DF18400B46979C9BECA58C125ACF.description:
Estimate and determine the percentage of a given whole number, including but not limited to
the use of benchmark percentages.Â

7E37A93B232546FEAC30F9C88C562EA2.description:
Apply proportional reasoning to solve problems in context, including converting units of
measurement, when given the conversion factor.Â

C3DEB65A2BF04910AD4FF324DADED13A.description:
Write and solve a proportion that represents a proportional relationship between two
quantities to find a missing value, including problems in context.

0EC2FD2633B946A18B3CBCF89257B344.description:
Given a proportional relationship between two quantities, create and use a ratio table to
determine missing values.

D6E34663A861403EB202176B25F5BE92.description:
The student will solve problems, including those in context, involving proportional
relationships.

CF6A48C82A754DB1B3F20487D189D9E4.description:
Estimate, solve, and justify solutions to contextual problems involving addition, subtraction,
multiplication, and division with rational numbers expressed as integers, fractions (proper or
improper), mixed numbers, and decimals. Fractions may be positive or negative. Decimals
may be positive or negative and are limited to the thousandths place.

A8CD8B010FAC4A02940416AC14AE71AE.description:
The student will estimate, solve, and justify solutions to multistep contextual problems
involving operations with rational numbers.

5982D22E93D74AD7B8D30CAC28EAD506.description: Describe the relationship between square roots and perfect squares.*Â

1C17300A5970404A829922DE4F081BBC.description: Determine the positive square root of a perfect square from 0 to 400.*

7307B7BF2CAD48F9A0FE1455449BF16F.description:
The student will recognize and describe the relationship between square roots and
perfect squares.

76DF4556292F4114AFF7CC5F2EC98401.description:
Use multiple strategies (e.g., benchmarks, number line, equivalency) to compare (using
symbols <, >, =) and order (a set of no more than four) rational numbers expressed as
integers, fractions (proper or improper), mixed numbers, decimals, and percents. Fractions
and mixed numbers may be positive or negative. Decimals may be positive or negative and
are limited to the thousandths place. Ordering may be in ascending or descending order.
Justify solutions orally, in writing or with a model.*Â

106C956BF80845E2B45D3989BB338A6B.description:
The student will reason and use multiple strategies to compare and order rational
numbers.

1E8784FE14AA4CC490A22D7F2AD107A3.description:
Compare and order no more than four numbers greater than 0 written in scientific notation.
Ordering may be in ascending or descending order.*

B2F1E6EF6195457C9FF7B747A1D7DCB6.description: Convert between numbers greater than 0 written in scientific notation and decimals.*

E66E8FA8237E4057891D3B8A9CA90AF0.description: Represent a power of 10 with a negative exponent in fraction and decimal form.

66B433AB822D4526A1D68B95A45DD69E.description: Investigate and describe powers of 10 with negative exponents by examining patterns.

4DA014E9E414422AAECA4D0CF3692596.description:
The student will investigate and describe the concept of exponents for powers of ten and
compare and order numbers greater than zero written in scientific notation.
